au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig
Class AbstractRig

java.lang.Object
  au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.AbstractRig
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRig, IRigExerciser, IRigSession
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractControlledRig, ConfiguredRig
public abstract class AbstractRig
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRig

Abstract rig type class that contains lists of the following actions:

  • IAcessAction
  • ISlaveAccessAction
  • IResetAction
  • INotifyAction
  • ITestActionM
  • IActivityDetectorAction
When a method is called, the corresponding action list is iterated through and the action initiating method is called. For example, if the startTests method is called, the ITestAction list is iterated through and the startTest method is called.

          Action types that may be registered with registerAction.

setMaintenance

public boolean setMaintenance(boolean offline,
                              java.lang.String reason,
                              boolean runTests)
Description copied from interface: IRigExerciser
Sets the maintenance state of the rig. If the passed offline flag is true, the rig is put into maintenance, otherwise the rig is taken out of maintenance mode and the rig maintenance reason is cleared if it set.

If the rig is to be put into maintenance, the stopTests flag specifies if the exerciser tests should be run in maintenance mode. If the rig is being taken out of maintenance mode, the stopTests flag is ignored (if the rig is operational, the exerciser should always run).

Specified by:
setMaintenance in interface IRigExerciser
Parameters:
offline - true if the rig is put into maintenance mode
reason - a reason why the rig is being put in maintenance mode
runTests - true if rig exerciser tests should be run in maintenance mode
Returns:
true if operation successful, false otherwise

addSlave

                        boolean passive)
Description copied from interface: IRigSession
Adds a slave user to the rig session. The meaning of the passive flag is specific to the rig type but may mean view only restrictions. This will fail if the rig is not in session, as slave users may not initiate sessions.

Specified by:

hasPermission

public boolean hasPermission(java.lang.String name,
                             IRigSession.Session ses)
Description copied from interface: IRigSession
Checks if the user has the specified permission type. The session permission hierarchy is from highest to lowest:
  1. Master
  2. Active Slave
  3. Passive Slave
  4. Not in session
So for example, a master user has the permission of an active slave and below and an active slave has permission of a passive slave and below but not a master user permission. By definition, a master user is also an active slave and a passive slave. Semantically, a session user is NOT not in session, however, an in session user should be able to do anything a not in session user can do (which just happens to be nothing!).

Specified by:
hasPermission in interface IRigSession
Parameters:
name - user name to check
ses - Session session enumeration
Returns:
true if the user has the permission (or equivalent).

isInSession

public IRigSession.Session isInSession(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: IRigSession
Checks the users session. The return may be:
  • Session.MASTER - master user - session initiator, should have complete access to rig, including assigning slave users.
  • Session.SLAVE_ACTIVE - active slave user (should have the same rig access rigs as the master user, except assigning slave users.
  • code>Session.SLAVE_PASSIVE - passive slave user (should have restricted access, perhaps read-only access.
  • Session.NOT_IN - user not in session.

Specified by:
isInSession in interface IRigSession
Parameters:
name - the name of to user to check if in session
Returns:
enumeration value of Session

Displays a notification message to the user(s) who are in session. If this method is invoked when a session is not active, it will return false.

isActivityDetected

public boolean isActivityDetected()
Description copied from interface: IRigSession
Detect if any activity is present on the rig (i.e. if a user has been assigned, they are actually using the experiment.). NOTE: If this cannot be detected for the experiment type, the response should be true as a false response may mean the rig is eligible for reassignment.

Specified by:
isActivityDetected in interface IRigSession
Returns:
true if activity is detected

revokeSlave

public boolean revokeSlave(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: IRigSession
Revokes a slave user from the rig session. Does not end the rig session. If the supplied user is not an existing slave user this method will succeed (as they will not have slave access).

Specified by:
revokeSlave in interface IRigSession
Parameters:
name - slave users name
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise
